availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard J. Browne (Washington co. State Rep & lawyer)

body.p: Springfield, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Harriet Browne. Attorney in Springfield in 1850. Attorney and farmer in Washington County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved people in 1850 and 1860. Practiced law with John W. Lewis. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Washington County from 1862 to 1863.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Town of Springfield, p. 238 B; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Town of Springfield; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District No. 2, p. 1; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, Ky.: Collins & Co., 1882), 749; The Biographical Encyclopædia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, Vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong, 1878), 336.
